name: Business policies and procedures are inconsistent or contradictory
description: Rationale and/or practical approach adopted for particular business objectives introduce obstacles to the successful completion of other business activities.
notes:
- Are business policies and procedures conceived with consideration of the operations of the repository as a whole?
- Are mechanisms in place to resolve conflicting policies and/or procedures? 

The full description of this risk has been obtained from examples provided in DRAMBORA - Digital Repository Audit Method Based on Risk Assessment, March 2007, Digital Curation Centre (DCC) and Digital Preservation Europe (DPE), http://www.repositoryaudit.eu/
preMitigationNotes: - Repository requires staff to undertake quality assurance procedures for each object ingested, which takes on average 10 minutes, although an additional policy states that ingest should be completed in 10 minutes
mitigationStrategy:
Avoidance strategies:
- Expose policies and procedures to regular review to determine their consistency with respect to organisational goals
- Seek external validation of policies and procedures (e.g. accredited auditors or user communities) In the event of riskâ€™s execution:
- Identify those policies that are inconsistent and revise them accordingly
